result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lamartre A Walton

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Restitution Worksheet filed by ADA Benjamin Wesson on behalf of the State.

Defendant Lamartre A Walton in court IN CUSTODY with attorney Eric M. Hailstock.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count #1 dismissed and read-in for sentencing purposes.

Attorney Eric M. Hailstock in court, defendant Lamartre A Walton not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties unable to proceed with a Plea and Sentencing Hearing today.
Atty. Hailstock is currently in trial in another court on an unrelated matter.
Case adjourned to 07-24-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Plea and Sentencing Hearing.
Defendant's Character Witness Letter filed by defendant's great aunt.
Defendant's Character Witness Letter filed by defendant's father.
Defendant's Character Witness Letter filed by defendant's grandmother.

Attorney Eric M. Hailstock in court, defendant Lamartre A Walton not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Judge Donald is currently in trial on an unrelated matter.
Case adjourned to 06-22-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

Attorney Eric M. Hailstock in court, defendant Lamartre A Walton not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a Projected Plea Hearing date.
Case adjourned to 04-17-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Projected Plea Hearing.

Attorney Eric M. Hailstock in court, defendant Lamartre A Walton not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter in court for status of counsel.
Atty. Eric Hailstock is now the attorney of record for the defendant.
Case adjourned to 02-27-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Scheduling Conference.

Defendant Lamartre A Walton in court with attorney Jon Alfonso Lamendola.  Defendant Lamartre A Walton in custody.  Catelin Ringersma for Benjamin Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter in court on Atty. LaMendola's motion to withdraw as counsel for the defendant.
There is a client/attorney breakdown in communication.
Statements made.
Court ALLOWS Atty. LaMendola to withdraw as counsel for the defendant.
Atty. Jon LaMendola is now discharged.
Atty. LaMendola is to ensure new counsel is appointed by the next court date.
Case adjourned to 01-26-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Status of Counsel.
Counsel's Motion for Withdrawl with attached Affidavit filed by Atty. Jon LaMendola.

Attorney Jon Alfonso Lamendola in court, defendant Lamartre A Walton not in court, in custody.  Benjamin A. Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense requests a motion to withdraw hearing date.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 12-17-2014 at 3:00 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Motion to Withdraw Hearing.

Attorney Jon Alfonso Lamendola in court, defendant Lamartre A Walton not in court, in custody.  Benjamin A. Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties unable to proceed with a Plea Hearing today.
State recently received more discovery.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 11-18-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Status Conference.

Attorney Jon Alfonso LaMendola in court, defendant Lamartre A Walton not in court, in custody.  Benjamin A. Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

State is awaiting information from Federal DA's office.
Parties request a Projected Plea Hearing date.
Case adjourned to 10-09-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Projected Plea Hearing.

Attorney Jon Alfonso LaMendola in court, defendant Lamartre A Walton not in court, in custody.  Benjamin A. Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a Status Conference date.
Case adjourned to 09-10-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Status Conference.

Attorney Jon Alfonso LaMendola in court, defendant Lamartre A Walton not in court, in custody.   No appearance by the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Ben Wesson does not appear.
Defense advised the clerk that the parties are still under negotiations and requests another Status Conference date.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 07-28-2014 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Status Conference.

Attorney Jon A LaMendola in court, defendant Lamartre A Walton not in court, in custody.  Benjamin A Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not present. Defendant serving a juvenile commitment. Case adjourned for a Status Conference in Branch 2. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date received, signed, and filed with court.

Attorney Jon A LaMendola in court, Defendant Lamartre A Walton not in court, in custody.  Benjamin A Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not present. Defendant serving a juvenile commitment. Case adjourned for a Status Conference in Branch 2. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date received, signed, and filed with court.  Status conference scheduled for July 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Jon A LaMendola in court, defendant Lamartre A Walton not in court, in custody.  Benjamin A Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

Off record - court is in trial

Defense request for an adjourned status date to coordinate with the co-defendants cases is approved.  Case is adjourned for status in Branch 2.  Status conference scheduled for 05-20-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Jon Alfonso LaMendola in court, defendant Lamartre A Walton not in court, IN CUSTODY at Lincoln Hills School for Boys.  Benjamin A. Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties still under negotiations.
Case adjourned to 04-17-2014 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Status Conference.

Attorney Jon A La Mendola APPEARS TELEPHONICALLY, defendant Lamartre A Walton not in court, IN CUSTODY.  Benjamin A Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter in court for status of new counsel.
Atty. Jon LaMendola is now the attorney of record for the defendant.
Defendant picked up new charges and there is a preliminary hearing on said charges on 02-24-2014.
Case adjourned to 03-13-2014 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Status Conference.

Defendant Lamartre A Walton in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Lamartre A Walton IN CUSTODY.   ADA Benjamin Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
This matter was originally scheduled for a scheduling conference today, however, new developments prevent the parties from proceeding.
Atty. Taylor moves to withdraw as counsel for the defendant; Atty. Taylor has a conflict in her office.
No objections.
Court GRANTS "oral" motion and allows Atty. Valeria Taylor to withdraw as counsel for the defendant.
Atty. Taylor to ensure that new counsel is appointed for the defendant.
Case adjourned to 02-21-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Status of Counsel.

Defendant Lamartre A Walton in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Lamartre A Walton in custody.  Benjamin A Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Richard Johnson for Valeria Lenise Taylor in court.  Benjamin A Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense Counsel waives the appearance of the defendant.  Court orders Eshe O. REMOVED from the Written No Contact Order.
NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION TO REDUCE BAIL from Attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Andrea D.; Landmark Credit Union and Eshe O.

Defendant Lamartre A Walton in court with attorney Eric M Vega.  Defendant Lamartre A Walton in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.   Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
